definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.chinese: 預見到會有虧損，雍容大度地接受虧損。

sentences.english: Can they foresee obstacles between the research and the clinic?
sentences.chinese: 他們能夠預見研究與臨牀之間的障礙嗎？

sentences.english: In our world, not only do we have variability, we've got unpredictability.
sentences.chinese: 在我們的世界不僅有可變性，還有不可預見性。

sentences.english: Syme's fate was not difficult to foresee.
sentences.chinese: 賽麥的下場是不難預見的。

sentences.english: But it isn't hard to foresee how visionary circadian-clock therapies might work.
sentences.chinese: 但是不難預見想象的生物鐘治療法會怎樣起作用。

sentences.english: Can foreknow, in future inside two years, mainstream website of home will be used .
sentences.chinese: 可以預見，在未來兩年內，國內的主流網站都將使用。

sentences.english: Predictably, most songwriters don't dig this kind of use.
sentences.chinese: 可以預見的是，大多數歌曲不挖這種使用。

sentences.english: The cost of litigation will be more affordable and predictable.
sentences.chinese: 訴訟費將更注重民衆經濟能力，更具有可能預見性。

sentences.english: The discovery was foreseen more than 150 years ago by Michael Faraday, the father of electricity.
sentences.chinese: 電學之父法拉第早到150年前就預見了這個發現。

sentences.english: The second chapter is study on the basic structure of the foreseeability rule.
sentences.chinese: 第二章主要對可預見性規則的基本構造作了研究。

sentences.english: Strange is, have foreknow prospective different can Marie has been broken recall.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的是，具有預見未來異能的瑪麗已經失憶。

sentences.english: It can be noted that the concept of reasonable foreseeability is used often by the law.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是法律上經常使用合理預見這一概念。

sentences.english: In this thesis, the foreseeability rule of the contract law is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 本文對合同法領域的可預見性規則作了研究。

sentences.english: Can foreknow , associate one of leaders that will make PC market.
sentences.chinese: 可以預見，聯想將成爲PC市場的領導者之一。

definition: lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
(of a check etc) to cash/to honor a commitment
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
